fields.name: choices

fields.name: fieldLabel

fields.name: fieldType

fields.name: required
fields.description: Is this field required when making connection

fields.name: endDate

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: createUser
fields.description: Registrer a new user

enumValues.name: express_interest
enumValues.description: Volunteer expresses interest but does not reserve a spot in the system

enumValues.name: signup
enumValues.description: Volunteer reserves a spot in the system upon connection

fields.name: categories
fields.description: 1 to 3 cause categories of this opportunity

fields.name: connectionType
fields.description: The connection type

fields.name: container
fields.description: The container this opportunity is grouped in

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: The custom questions this opportunity ask the volunteers to fill out

fields.name: datePosted
fields.description: Date posted

fields.name: dateRange
fields.description: opportunity date range

fields.name: description
fields.description: The opportunity description. Supports some basic HTML for formatting, supported elements include div,ul,p,br,li,ol

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: Externally provided unique identifier for the opportunity, for opportunities originating from an external source

fields.name: greatFor
fields.description: The group of people this opportunity is friendly for

fields.name: groupSize
fields.description: opportunity GroupSize, needs to be one of: 5,10,20 or 10000"

fields.name: id
fields.description: VolunteerMatch's unique identifier for the opportunity

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: The URL for this opportunity's profile image (if any)

fields.name: location
fields.description: opportunity location

fields.name: parentOrg
fields.description: The organization this opportunity belongs to

fields.name: plaintextDescription
fields.description: opportunity description with no HTML tags

fields.name: requirements
fields.description: The requirements to volunteer for this opportunity

fields.name: shifts
fields.description: The shifts of this opportunity

fields.name: skillsNeeded
fields.description: The skills needed for this opportunity in plain text, semicolon separated

fields.name: specialFlag
fields.description: The special flag tagged to this opportunity, currently only covid19 is supported

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The opportunity keywords entered by its administrator

fields.name: timeCommitment
fields.description: Time commitment

fields.name: title
fields.description: opportunity title

fields.name: url
fields.description: The VolunteerMatch website URL for this opportunity

fields.name: volunteersNeeded
fields.description: The number of volunteers this opportunity needs

inputFields.name: categories
inputFields.description: Search by the opportunity's cause categories

inputFields.name: connectionType
inputFields.description: Defines how a user can participate in this opportunity

inputFields.name: containers
inputFields.description: An array of container names. This is used to limit the search to opportunities that are for the organizations in the given containers. Contact VolunteerMatch for valid container names.

inputFields.name: dateRanges
inputFields.description: The date ranges of opportunities you want to search for.

inputFields.name: descriptions
inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a text search against opportunities's description, i.e., descriptions: ["girls","boys"]

inputFields.name: eins
inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a text search against opportunities's parent Organization's EIN, i.e., eins: ["123456789","12-3456789"]

inputFields.name: greatFor
inputFields.description: Search opportunities are friendly for these groups of people

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description: Search Opportunities by an array of opportunity IDs

inputFields.name: includeRegional
inputFields.description: Set to false if we don't want to include regional/national opportunities. Default is true

inputFields.name: keywords
inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a keyword search against opportunities's title, org name, description, skills, and categories, i.e., keywords: ["girls","boys"]

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description: Free-form location text, i.e., location: "san francisco", or location: "94111"

inputFields.name: numberOfResults
inputFields.description: The number of search results per page. Default max is 20 unless your account allows more than the default

inputFields.name: orgIds
inputFields.description: An array of Organization IDs to search by

inputFields.name: orgNames
inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a text search against opportunities's parent Organization names, i.e., orgNames: ["girls","boys"]

inputFields.name: pageNumber
inputFields.description: The page number of the search result

inputFields.name: partners
inputFields.description: An array of opportunities's parent organization's National or multi-chapter organization IDs

inputFields.name: radius
inputFields.description: The supported search radius values are: a number(in miles), city, subregion(county), msa, region(state), country

inputFields.name: returnVirtualAndOnSiteOpps
inputFields.description: Set to true if we want to include virtual opportunities when virtual = false and location is set  Be ignored when virtual = true

inputFields.name: skills
inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a text search against opportunities's needed skills, i.e., skills: ["computer","child care"]

inputFields.name: sortByContainers
inputFields.description: An array of container names used when sortCriteria is set to "container". Opportunities will be sorted according to the order of these containers. Contact VolunteerMatch for valid container names.

inputFields.name: sortCriteria
inputFields.description: The sort criteria for the search result, if non specified, the default is 'distanceBand'

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The the sort order of the search result. Supported values: asc or desc

inputFields.name: specialFlag
inputFields.description: Provides the ability to filter only specially flagged opportunities for time sensitive needs. Currently 'covid19' is the only active value.

inputFields.name: virtual
inputFields.description: Set to true if we want to include opportunities without a location

inputFields.name: virtualOrgRegion
inputFields.description: Allows filtering of virtual opportunities by the region the organization is located in. Ignored if virtual is false or omitted. Free-form organization region text, i.e., virtualOrgRegion: "CA", or virtualOrgRegion: "94111". For US-based locations, region will always resolve to a state.

inputFields.description: Search by the organization's cause categories

inputFields.description: User enter an array of Strings. This is a keyword search against organizations title, org name, description, skills, and categories, i.e., keywords: ["girls","boys"]

inputFields.description: Free-form location text, i.e., location: "san francisco", or location: "94111"

inputFields.description: The number of search results per page. Default max is 20 unless your account allows more than the default

types.name: RSVPDetail
types.description: Shows the connection/signup detail. If this opportunity's connection type is signup, rsvpDetail will return this opportunity's remaining signup space and notes. If the opportunity's connection type is express_interest or null, rsvpDetail will return null.

fields.name: availableSignupSpace
fields.description: Shows the remaining available space for signup if this opportunity's connection type is signup

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Indicates if availableSignupSpace is estimated or not

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: The current page number of the total search result

fields.name: numberOfResults
fields.description: The number of results return per page

fields.name: resultsSize
fields.description: The total number of search result

enumValues.name: container
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's container using the order of containers requested. Contact VolunteerMatch for valid container names.

enumValues.name: distance
enumValues.description: Sort by distance

enumValues.name: distanceBand
enumValues.description: Sort by a combination of distance and newness, allowing the closest and newest opportunities to appear first. This is the default sort criteria if non are specified.

enumValues.name: eventdate
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's event date

enumValues.name: orgname
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's parent organization's name.

enumValues.name: popularity
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's volunteer sign up count

enumValues.name: recency
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's posting date

enumValues.name: relevance
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's relevance based on keywords.

enumValues.name: update
enumValues.description: Sort by opportunity's last update date, the latest appears first

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: adminOfOrgs
fields.description: Organizations for which this user is an administrator

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: First name

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Last name

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution
